intro: Argomuellera sessilifolia, commonly known as the sessile-leaf argomuellera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, sessile leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its ecosystem.
